intro: Megacarpaea delavayi f. angustisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed form of the Chinese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers with a prominent central stigma. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
